title: Understanding Self-Esteem
text: Self-esteem is a complex concept that involves how we perceive ourselves. It is not just about feeling good or bad about oneself.

title: Components of Self-Esteem
text: Think about the different ways people evaluate themselves. This can include their thoughts, feelings, and assessments of their own abilities.

hintAnswer: (1) the positive and negative thoughts people have about themselves, (2) how people rate their $$self-worth$$, and (3) evaluating their own abilities and personal characteristics
title: Identifying the Parts
text: Consider the following aspects: (1) thoughts about oneself, (2) self-worth, and (3) personal abilities. How do these relate to self-esteem?
choices: (1) the positive and negative thoughts people have about themselves, (2) how people rate their $$self-worth$$, and (3) evaluating their own abilities and personal characteristics
